definition: to be embarrassingly short of money

sentences.english: QinQiong clemson is already in debt for seven days of the rent money not to.
sentences.chinese: 秦瓊囊中羞澀，已經欠了七天的房租錢未給。

sentences.english: The embarrassed-looking Ms. Zhang accepted the proposal as the crowd chanted 'Marry him!'
sentences.chinese: 人羣高喊“嫁給他”，羞澀的張新宇答應了。

sentences.english: It is my own anklets that grow loud at every step and I am ashamed.
sentences.chinese: 是我自己的腳鐲越走越響使我羞澀。

sentences.english: They are poor; they love money and getting a paycheck.
sentences.chinese: 他們囊中羞澀，因此喜歡錢，喜歡領薪水。

sentences.english: Those of black smoke came damp, suddenly, the guy red sad.
sentences.chinese: 羞澀的眼色碰上受潮的煙，倏忽，哀愁的眼孔通紅。

sentences.english: Youlan also felt too shy the.
sentences.chinese: 尤蘭也覺得自己太過於羞澀了。

sentences.english: The inceptive impression of him is simple and honest , slightly shy .
sentences.chinese: 起初的印象是憨厚，略帶羞澀。

sentences.english: Hearing our praise, she smiled somewhat shyly.
sentences.chinese: 勞麗晴見我們誇她，有些羞澀地笑了笑。

sentences.english: People who always had very little now have nothing.
sentences.chinese: 本來就囊中羞澀的人們如今一無所有。

sentences.english: In the belly hungry, but poorer path bite gold think out money fast trick.
sentences.chinese: 肚中飢餓，但囊中羞澀的程咬金想出來錢快的鬼點子。

sentences.english: Happy skirt, heavy flavor love shyness, very beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 快樂裙襬，重味初戀的羞澀，很美好。

sentences.english: "I don't know," she said shyly with her eyes downcast.
sentences.chinese: “我也不知道”，她目光低垂，話語中帶着幾絲羞澀。

sentences.english: Feeling our pockets we were shy. Poor students could not afford it.
sentences.chinese: 摸摸錢包，頗覺羞澀，漫辦法，窮學生坐不起。

sentences.english: This restaurant catered to large appetites and modest purses.
sentences.chinese: 這家飯館向胃口很大但囊中羞澀的人供餐。

sentences.english: I wanted to see her unabashed expression of joy.
sentences.chinese: 我想看看褪去羞澀後的她歡欣雀躍時的一面。

definition: to blush/to redden (with shame, indignation etc)
next-door neighbor/neighboring household/adjacent country (short for 鄰接的國家|邻接的国家[lin2 jie1 de5 guo2 jia1])
to remain silent/to have nothing to say/(coll.) speechless/dumbfounded
to act like a spoiled child/to throw a tantrum/to act coquettishly
